critique: This document is a waiver of the application of sections 402(a) and 402(b) of the Trade Act of 1974 with respect to Tajikistan and Turkmenistan. It's difficult to assess a strong political bias based solely on this action. The waiver relates to trade, so it has some economic implications. It's an executive action, but it's based on existing law. There's no clear indication of impact on immigration, national security, or social inclusion. The federalism aspect is neutral as it's a federal action within the scope of international trade agreements.
